creator: harishmunurai@gmail.com
text:
Have upgraded to stable openssl version 1.1.0c for better security concern.
However, when i try to connect the server from outside with openssl, i still see the old version of openssl. Please help me, how to remove the old version completely.

Hi! openssl 1.1.x is still not supported, there is a svn branch that collects all the code changes needed to 2.4.x though (http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/httpd/httpd/branches/2.4.x-openssl-1.1.0-compat) but it is still work in progress. 

The support *might* be available for the next release.
creator: toscano.luca@gmail.com
ylavic.dev@gmail.com
text:
This bugzilla is for reporting bugs, not for support.
Please use the users@httpd.apache.org mailing list.

creator: harishmunurai@gmail.com
text:
Hi Luca, 

Thanks for the update. But everything is working fine with openssl 1.1.0c in Apache 2.4.23. I have already removed open ssl 1.0.2j. Do i need to revert back the changes?

creator: harishmunurai@gmail.com
text:
Hi Yunn,

Thanks for the information.
